sentence.Network_en: He has failed to dissociate himself clearly and unambiguously from the attack.
sentence.Network_cn: 他未能干净利落地同那起攻击事件撇清关系。

sentence.Network_en: He tried to dissociate himself from the party's more extreme views.
sentence.Network_cn: 他极力表明自己并不赞成该党较为偏激的观点。

sentence.Network_en: It is difficult to dissociate the man from his position.
sentence.Network_cn: 一想到这个人,就很难不联想起他的职位.

PerfectNetExp.abs: videotape... ... dissociate oneself from 割断与...的关系表示自己不赞成... dissociated 解离的 - dissociableness 孤癖.
2. 孤僻的dissociate 分裂，使脱离-
391.hydrochloric 氯化氢的盐酸的392.dissociate 电离分离393.ionize 使离子化电离
She dissociate herself from the bigotry in her past ., 她力图使自己摆脱她以前的偏见.

list.abs: dissociation constant 离解常数dissociation energy 离解能dissociation pressure 离解压
电离常数亦称电离平衡常数,是弱电解质溶液中电离平衡的常数,用Ki表示。电解常数是电解质...强电离没有固定的电离常数,电离常数亦称离解常数(Dissociation Constant).
(2)分离性神游症(dissociative fugue)：是解离性障碍的一种特殊形式患者常在急剧的精神刺激作用下发病突然从某一地方向另一地区游 …
...（Dissociative Amnesia） • 解离性漫游症（Dissociative Fugue） • 解离性身分疾患（Dissociative Identity Disorder） • 自我感消失.
1.解离性失忆症（Dissociative amnesia）：发作通常很突然。患者会无法回忆先前的生活、抑或人格。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin dissociat- 'separated', from the verb dissociare, from dis- (expressing reversal) + sociare 'join together' (from socius 'companion')

entry.tran: (通常指为了避免麻烦和责难而)与…断绝关系，表明与…没有关系
entry.def: If you dissociate yourself from something or someone, you say or show that you are not connected with them, usually in order to avoid trouble or blame.

example.ex: It is getting harder for the president to dissociate himself from the scandal.
example.tran: 总统越来越难摆脱这一丑闻了。

entry.def: If you dissociate one thing from another, you consider the two things as separate from each other, or you separate them.

example.ex: Almost the first lesson they learn is how to dissociate emotion from reason.
example.tran: 如何将理智和情感分开几乎可以说是他们所上的第一课。

means.word_mean: 1. part; cease or break association with;

sentences.sentence: "She disassociated herself from the organization when she found out the identity of the president"

means.word_mean: 3. to undergo a reversible or temporary breakdown of a molecule into simpler molecules or atoms;

auth_sentence.content: The Muslim Brotherhood is trying hard to dissociate itself from the Salafis.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Muslim Brotherhood is trying hard to dissociate itself from the Salafis.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Muslim Brotherhood is trying hard to dissociate itself from the Salafis.

auth_sentence.content: The process would be; dissociate, cool, separate, distribute and sell!
auth_sentence.res_content: The process would be; dissociate, cool, separate, distribute and sell!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The process would be; dissociate, cool, separate, distribute and sell!

auth_sentence.content: Our very...desires, which first bring us together, have a tendency likewise to dissociate us.
auth_sentence.res_content: Our very...desires, which first bring us together, have a tendency likewise to dissociate us.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Our very...desires, which first bring us together, have a tendency likewise to dissociate us.

stems_affixes.type_exp: = companion,表示"同伴[引申为社团,社会]",

stems_affixes.value_cn: 好交际的,友好的,合群的
stems_affixes.word_buile: soci同伴[引申为社团,社会]+able能……的→adj.好交际的,友好的,合群的
soci同伴[引申为社团,社会]+al……的→adj.社会的;交际的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 联盟,协会,社团;交往,联合;联想
stems_affixes.word_buile: associate[v.联合,结合]+ion表名词→n.联盟,协会,社团;交往,联合;联想
social[adj.社会的;交际的]+ism主义→n.社会主义
social[adj.社会的;交际的]+ity表名词→n.社交,交际,社会性

stems_affixes.value_cn: 社会;社团,协会,社;社交界,上流社会
stems_affixes.word_buile: soci同伴[引申为社团,社会]+ety表名词→n.社会;社团,协会,社;社交界,上流社会
soci同伴[引申为社团,社会]+ology学科→n.社会学
as加强+soci社团+ate表动词→结成团队→联合
con共同+soci同伴[引申为社团,社会]+ate使……→成为共同的社会
dis分开+soci同伴[引申为社团,社会]+ate表动词→伙伴分开,分离

sentences.en: The editor dissociated herself from the views in the article.
sentences.cn: 编者声明那篇文章的观点不代表她的观点。
